ftc.team6460.javadeck.api.motion.impl

Class ParallelDrivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • ftc.team6460.javadeck.api.motion.impl.ParallelDrivetrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VelocityDrivetrain

    public class ParallelDrivetrain
extends java.lang.Object
implements VelocityDrivetrain
    Describes a drivetrain with two sides both making parallel contributions to the robot's motion (e.g. 4 wheels laid out similarly to those on an automobile without steering, or two tank treads mounted on opposite sides) The motor polarity is assumed such that positive power causes that side of robot to move forward

    • Constructor Summary

      void spinInPlace(double tangentialVelocity)

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(double forwardVelocity)
                 throws PeripheralInoperableException,
                        PeripheralCommunicationException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: VelocityDrivetrain
        Sets the movement on this drivetrain to be forward or backward. Must be thread-safe.
        Specified by:
        setVelocity in interface VelocityDrivetrain
        Parameters:
        forwardVelocity - The velocity with which to move the robot forward, in meters per second.
        Throws:
        PeripheralInoperableException - If a motor or other drivetrain part is inoperable.
        PeripheralCommunicationException - If a motor or other drivetrain part cannot be communicated with.
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • spinInPlace

        public void spinInPlace(double tangentialVelocity)
                 throws PeripheralInoperableException,
                        PeripheralCommunicationException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: VelocityDrivetrain
        Sets the movement on this drivetrain to spin in place. Must be thread-safe.
        Specified by:
        spinInPlace in interface VelocityDrivetrain
        Parameters:
        tangentialVelocity - The velocity with which to spin the robot. Right turns are positive, left turns are negative. Units are meters per second.
        Throws:
        PeripheralInoperableException - If a motor or other drivetrain part is inoperable.
        PeripheralCommunicationException - If a motor or other drivetrain part cannot be communicated with.
        java.lang.InterruptedException
